title: Add restricted and password parameters to bulk upload endpoint
description:
Extend the bulk upload API endpoint (/api/photos/bulk-upload) to support creating restricted collections with passwords.

New Parameters:
- is_restricted: Boolean indicating if collection should be restricted (default: false)
- access_password: Plain text password for restricted collections (will be hashed server-side)

Behavior:
- When uploading to NEW collection:
  * Accept is_restricted and access_password parameters
  * Set Collection.isRestricted based on parameter
  * Hash and store access_password if provided
- When uploading to EXISTING collection:
  * Ignore is_restricted and access_password parameters
  * Existing collection settings are preserved
  * Only collection_id, collection_name, and publish_status are honored

Validation:
- If is_restricted=true, access_password must be provided
- If is_restricted=false, access_password should be ignored
- Password hashing handled by Collection.setAccessPassword() method

Update iOS Shortcut documentation (docs/ios-shortcut-setup.md) to include:
- New form fields for restricted collections
- Workflow for creating password-protected albums
- Note that parameters only apply to new collections

Dependencies: Existing Collection entity already has isRestricted, accessPassword, and password verification methods

title: Build photo-showcase-horizontal Stimulus controller with seeded layout
description:
Create Stimulus controller for horizontal scroll photo showcase with deterministic layout generation:

Seeding System:
- Hash collection slug to seed number
- Seeded PRNG (Linear Congruential Generator) for consistent randomization
- Each collection gets unique but repeatable layout pattern

Layout Generation (per photo):
- Size tier (60vh, 75vh, 85vh) - seeded random selection
- Prairie line track (20%, 50%, 80% vertical) - seeded random selection
- Z-index: (photoIndex * 10) + random(0-100) for depth layering
- Horizontal overlap: negative margin 200-400px (seeded random)

Photo Positioning:
- Absolute positioning within scroll container
- Left position: cumulative width minus overlaps
- Top position: prairie line track (transform translateY)
- Width: calculated from height × aspectRatio
- Z-index: scroll-position based (later photos in front)

Scroll Transitions:
- IntersectionObserver for viewport detection
- Fade in from right: opacity 0→1, translateX(100px)→0
- Duration: 800ms, easing: cubic-bezier(0.4, 0, 0.2, 1)
- rootMargin: '0px 200px' (start before visible)

Hover Effects:
- Subtle lift: translateY(-4px) on current track
- Shadow increase (architectural shadow from design doc)
- No scale (maintain layout stability)

Keyboard Navigation:
- Arrow keys: scroll to next/prev photo (smooth)
- Home/End: jump to first/last
- Tab: focus follows, auto-scroll to center
- ARIA labels: "Photo X of Y: {title}"

Accessibility:
- prefers-reduced-motion: instant opacity, no slide
- Focus management and scroll-follow
- Screen reader live region for position updates

Lazy Loading:
- IntersectionObserver for images
- Load as photos approach viewport (rootMargin: 200px)

title: Enhance collection index page design with showcase-inspired layout
description:
Redesign the stills collection index page (/stills) to match the aesthetic of the photo showcase with the following improvements:

CURRENT STATE:
- Tight masonry grid with 24px gaps
- Collection cards with border, rounded corners, metadata below image
- Standard hover effects (scale, shadow)
- Currently at templates/stills/index.html.twig

DESIGN GOALS:
1. MORE WHITESPACE
   - Increase gaps between collection cards significantly (inspiration: showcase panels have massive negative space)
   - Reduce number of columns or increase container max-width to give images more breathing room
   - Add generous padding around the grid area

2. SUBTLE TILT/JITTER (like showcase slots)
   - Apply random subtle rotation to each collection card (±0.5 to 1.5 degrees)
   - Keep rotation consistent per collection (deterministic based on collection slug)
   - Similar to showcase slot rotations but more restrained for grid context

3. MUSEUM-STYLE LABELS
   - Replace bottom metadata section with overlaid museum label (like showcase photos)
   - Label should show: Collection name, location, year
   - Position: bottom-left corner of image (not below)
   - Style: bg-bone/90 backdrop-blur-sm with persimmon left border
   - Font: mono for location/year, display for name
   - Keep label visible on card (not just on hover)

4. REFINED INTERACTION
   - Remove border and rounded corners (showcase has none)
   - Keep subtle shadow or use none
   - On hover: slight lift (translateY) instead of scale
   - Maintain lazy loading and current masonry positioning

5. VISUAL CONSISTENCY
   - Match showcase aesthetic: warm minimalism, MCM/Eames influence, prairie lines
   - Use same paper grain background (already present)
   - Maintain object-cover for images
   - Keep persimmon accent color for interactive states

TECHNICAL CONSTRAINTS:
- Symfony 7.4 + Twig + Tailwind + Stimulus
- Must preserve existing stills-masonry controller functionality
- Keep lazy loading implementation
- Maintain responsive breakpoints (mobile: 1 col, tablet: 2 col, desktop: 3 col)
- Collections are from {% for collection in collections %} loop
- Collection data: name, slug, locationName, startDate, photoCount, coverPhoto

USE frontend-design skill to implement this design enhancement.

title: Build flipbook intro animation for homepage
description:
Build hero 'crank viewer' flipbook animation for homepage:

Content: Animated 'intro to me' showing software development, photography, and personal identity
- Flashing terminal with code
- Animated version of Sam (illustration/silhouette)
- Photography scenes (camera, taking pictures)
- Old school Mac (Lisa) with vintage Apple aesthetic
- Architectural elements (Frank Lloyd Wright influence)
- Zoom in/out transitions between scenes
- Interesting animated transitions matching modernist aesthetic

Behavior:
- Autoplays once on page load as main focal element
- Frame-by-frame sprite animation (like vintage film viewer)
- When animation completes: shrinks slightly to make room for other homepage sections (object cards)
- Users can click to re-open and manually scrub through sequence using crank interaction
- Crank metaphor: circular handle user drags to advance/rewind frames

Technical Implementation:
- Stimulus controller for crank interaction
- Sprite sheet or individual frames (60-120 frames recommended for smooth transitions)
- Canvas or CSS sprite animation
- Smooth frame interpolation based on crank rotation angle
- Autoplay on mount, then shrink with smooth transition
- Click to expand back to hero size
- Progressive enhancement (show static poster frame if JS disabled)

Mobile Adaptations:
- Crank interaction TBD (drag might be flakey - consider swipe, timeline scrubber, or auto-play only)
- Consider reducing frame count on mobile for performance (30-60 frames)
- Ensure touch targets are large enough (44px minimum)
- Test various UX patterns for scrubbing (horizontal slider, circular drag, prev/next buttons)

Visual Design:
- Cube-shaped flipbook machine with vintage aesthetic
- Crank handle on right side (rotates when user drags or auto-playing)
- Frame viewport in center of cube (animation displays here)
- Warm materials: walnut wood texture, cognac leather accents, bone/putty borders
- Museum label at bottom: 'Drag Crank to Explore' (or 'Auto-Playing' during intro)
- Signal red accent on crank handle
- CSS 3D transforms for cube depth and crank rotation
- Shrunk state: corner position with subtle pulse/glow to indicate interactivity
- Match modernist aesthetic with restrained animation easing

Animation Production:
- Create storyboard with key scenes
- Export as sprite sheet or individual PNG sequence
- Optimize for web (WebP format, compressed)
- Target ~2-3MB total file size
